creator: hackwrench@hotmail.com
text:
All of the text files end in .txt but some are apparently sent as application/object-stream. I'm having the Wii Opera browser read files from my computer and it reports back 240020: File format application/octet-stream not supported. Two lines of mime.types:
application/octet-stream	bin dms lha lrf lzh so iso dmg dist distz pkg bpk dump elc deploy
text/plain					txt text conf def list log in

A line in httpd.conf:
DefaultType text/plain

creator: hackwrench@hotmail.com
text:
I just whittled down a text file with one character, 'T' and the Wii Opera browser still gives the same error message. Some relatively large text files in the same directory go through okay.

I also have a .htaccess file with the following lines:
<Files *.txt>
ForceType text/plain
</Files>

I changed the first line to:
<Files *.*>

Still get error message.

creator: fielding@apache.org
text: This is most likely caused by the broken sniffing algorithm in that version of Opera.  A possible workaround would be to add a charset parameter to the type.
